Enterprise Solution

Company Intranet Portal

Modern enterprise intranet built with Vue 3 and TypeScript

Live Demo Source Code Documentation
Intranet Screenshot

Project Overview

A comprehensive enterprise intranet portal designed to streamline internal business operations and enhance team productivity. Built with modern Vue 3 architecture and TypeScript for type safety, this solution provides employee directory management, project collaboration tools, department organization, and real-time dashboards.

The application demonstrates advanced frontend architecture patterns including the Composition API, state management with Pinia, and responsive design principles. It's designed to scale from small teams to enterprise-level organizations with thousands of employees.

Key Features

Employee Directory

Comprehensive employee management with advanced search, filtering, and profile management capabilities.

Real-time Dashboard

Executive dashboards with metrics, project overviews, and company-wide statistics.

Project Management

Integrated project tracking, collaboration tools, and progress monitoring.

Secure Authentication

JWT-based authentication with role-based access control (RBAC).

Responsive Design

Fully responsive interface that works seamlessly across all devices.

Theme System

Dark/light themes with customizable company branding options.

Technology Stack

Frontend

Vue 3 TypeScript Tailwind CSS Vite

State Management

Pinia Vue Router 4

Development

ESLint Prettier Vitest

Deployment

GitHub Pages GitHub Actions Docker Ready

Code Example

// Employee store with Pinia
import { defineStore } from 'pinia'
import type { Employee } from '@/types'

export const useEmployeeStore = defineStore('employee', () => {
  const employees = ref<Employee[]>([])
  const loading = ref(false)
  const searchQuery = ref('')

  const searchEmployees = async (query: string) => {
    loading.value = true
    try {
      const response = await api.get('/employees/search', {
        params: { q: query }
      })
      employees.value = response.data
    } finally {
      loading.value = false
    }
  }

  const filteredEmployees = computed(() => {
    if (!searchQuery.value) return employees.value
    return employees.value.filter(emp => 
      emp.name.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.value.toLowerCase())
    )
  })

  return {
    employees,
    loading,
    searchQuery,
    searchEmployees,
    filteredEmployees
  }
})

SaaS Platform

D&D Dice Roller SaaS

Enterprise-grade dice rolling platform with subscription management

Test API Source Code API Docs
Dice Roller Interface

Project Overview

A comprehensive SaaS platform designed for D&D and tabletop RPG enthusiasts, providing enterprise-grade dice rolling services with subscription management, team collaboration, and extensive API access. The platform supports all standard D&D dice and custom dice configurations with advanced modifiers and calculations.

Built with a modern full-stack architecture, the platform includes automated deployment scripts, comprehensive monitoring, and production-ready infrastructure. It demonstrates advanced backend development patterns, payment integration, and scalable SaaS architecture.

Subscription Tiers

Free Tier

$0/month
  • 100 API calls/month
  • Basic dice rolling
  • Roll history (24h)
  • Community support

Pro Tier

$19.99/month
  • 10,000 API calls/month
  • Advanced modifiers
  • Team collaboration
  • Priority support
  • Custom webhooks

Enterprise

$99.99/month
  • 100,000 API calls/month
  • White-label options
  • SSO integration
  • SLA guarantees
  • Custom development

API Endpoints

POST
/api/v1/dice/roll
Roll dice with custom configuration
POST
/api/v1/dice/quick-roll/{type}
Quick single die roll
GET
/api/v1/dice/history
Get roll history
POST
/api/v1/subscriptions/create-checkout
Create Stripe checkout session

Framework Architecture

Project Overview

A comprehensive enterprise solution framework designed to accelerate the development of professional business applications. This template provides a solid foundation with modern architecture patterns, complete documentation structure, and scalable design principles.

The framework demonstrates best practices for enterprise software development, including comprehensive documentation strategies, architectural decision records, and professional project structure that can be adapted for various business domains.
